intro: Rumfordia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan rumfordia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentamerous flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or white. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and often have a rough texture. Rumfordia guatemalensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
